sentences.en: A carriage door struck him as a train drew into Basildon station.
sentences.cn: 当火车驶进巴斯尔登站时，一节车厢的门撞到他了。

sentences.en: Canals were originally built for the carriage of coal.
sentences.cn: 运河原先是为运煤而修建的。

sentences.en: Davis went to regain his carriage.
sentences.cn: 戴维斯回到他的马车上。

sentences.en: He sat in the corner of a second-class carriage.
sentences.cn: 他坐在一节二等车厢的角落里。

sentences.en: Her legs were long and fine, her hips slender, her carriage erect.
I dismissed the carriage and walked the last mile.
sentences.cn: 我把马车打发走了,徒步走完最后一英里路.

sentences.en: I fought my way into a carriage just before the doors closed.
sentences.cn: 我刚挤进车厢，车门就关上了。

sentences.en: I'll be sitting in the third carriage from the engine.
sentences.cn: 我将坐在机车后面的第三节车厢内.

sentences.en: The carriage can post from London to Bath in only two days.
sentences.cn: 这辆马车只要两天就能从伦敦赶到巴斯.

sentences.en: The carriage upset and we were all spilled into the ditch.
sentences.cn: 马车翻了,我们都摔到了沟里.

sentences.en: The carriage was spinning along at a good speed.
The company manufactured elegant railway carriages.
sentences.cn: 该公司生产雅致的火车车厢。

sentences.en: The conductor shambled to the next carriage.
sentences.cn: 售票员慵懒地拖着脚走向下一节车厢。
雇来的马车被打发走了。

sentences.en: The ladies rode in the carriage and we ran along beside.
sentences.cn: 女士们乘坐马车,我们则跟在车旁跑.

sentences.en: The president-elect followed in an open carriage drawn by six beautiful grey horses.
sentences.cn: 新当选的总统紧随其后，坐着6匹灰色骏马开道的敞篷马车。

sentences.en: The Queen arrived in a horse - drawn carriage.
This carriage has a seating capacity of 120 people.

phrases.tran_cn: 货运条件，运输条件；承运条件；运输条款
客车；铁道车；（英）火车车厢

trans.tran_cn: 马车，车厢，运费，运输，仪态
trans.tran_en: a vehicle with wheels that is pulled by a horse, used in the past
